reviewText: Man, I have to say that as a grown-up, I really liked this show. I felt alot of the episodes, especially the earlier ones were targeted towards the older crowd. If you knew your Batman mythos than there were hidden gems in each episode. So if I'm rambling about how much I liked this show than why did I give it 4 instead of 5 stars? Because there are only a few episodes. Where is the Season 1 box sets that we crave? Yes I bought this disk but I would prefer to by the season. Otherwise, if you need your Batman Beyond fix, buy the disk.

reviewText: I've been waiting for more Batman Beyond on DVD ever since they released the original movie disc years ago. Finally, WB is giving us more - not in season sets however, but in transfers of its old VHS tapes.This disc contains two of the old VHS compilation tapes, "Tech Wars" and "Disappearing Inque", for a total of six episodes. The six episodes are: Heroes, Lost Soul, Splicers, Black Out, Disappearing Inque, and Shriek. While Heroes is a bit of a dud, the other five episodes are all great entertainment.So is this disc worth a purchase? Well, it contains 6 episodes - 2 more than most of what WB's other animated Batman discs offer. It's also better than the other Batman Beyond compilation DVD recently released (School Dayz/Spellbound) which rehashes three episodes from the "Batman Beyond: The Movie" disc. HOWEVER, it appears that WB is dumping these compilation discs on us NOW to get all its VHS properties on DVD before starting on season sets. A box set of BTAS has been confirmed. Batman Beyond can't be too far behind, though it might still be a few years.Batman Beyond's a great series, and 6 episodes is worth the price of the disc. If you can't wait for the box sets, then this disc has enough value to be worth a purchase.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Batman beyond is possibly my favorite Batman ever. To me it mixes Spiderman personality with Batman's tools and money. This new Batman isn't wealthy, but he is tied to Bruce Wayne who supplies both resources and intelligence.I won't spend too much time here, because you're better off just buyingseason one. This was one of a set of two DVDs which was released by Warner Bros. prior to releasing the whole first season. In my opinion, it was a cash grab. I ended up with two of these as a gift because I didn't know they'd ever put the whole season out and I'd rather have the whole season.If you get this DVD andSchool Dayz, then you have almost every first season episode, except the pilot, Mr. freeze, and the one where Blight ends up bottom of the ocean. You also end up with a couple episodes of season two. I give this a decent score because the episodes are still great, but in just about every way, you're better off buyingseason oneinstead.
summary: You're better off buying season one
